result.execSummary:
The defendant Chadwick Randolph Clark was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Chadwick Randolph Clark is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Chadwick Randolph Clark was found guilty of 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).
  • Chadwick Randolph Clark was found guilty of Possession of Firearm by Felon, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: $518 costs--DOC collect within first 6 months of release from custody.  If extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes: $518 costs--DOC collect within first 6 months of release from custody.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Chadwick Randolph Clark
Current: P.O.Box 900, Racine Correctional Inst. Unit: Kenosha #527143, Sturtevant, WI 53177 United States  (Effective: 08-16-2016)
Prior: 409 Eighth Street, Beloit, WI 53511

Defendant Chadwick Randolph Clark in court in custody with attorney Jack C. Hoag.  Mark M. Jahnke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Count 2 dismissed.  Guilty plea to counts 1 and 3, Court finds defendant guilty.  PSI WAIVED.  Court orders:
#1:  2 years WSP, 5 years extended supervision, eligible for prison programs; 118 days sentence credit; DOC to collect costs within first 6 months of release from custody.
#3:  3 years probation, consecutive to count 1; no sentence credit.  Felon warnings advised.

Defendant Chadwick Randolph Clark in court in custody with attorney Jack C. Hoag.  Gerald Anthony Urbik appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Remove from trial calendar.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Chadwick Randolph Clark in court in custody with attorney Jack C. Hoag.  Scott H. Dirks appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Any motions to be filed by 5-5-2015.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury selection scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Calendar call on May 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Chadwick R. Clark in court in custody with attorney Jack C. Hoag.  Mary Elizabeth Bricco appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court denies motion for bond modification.  Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived.  Defendant stands mute, not guilty plea entered by court, jury trial to be set.

Defendant Chadwick R. Clark in court in custody with attorney Jack C. Hoag.  Gerald Anthony Urbik appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information.  Bond may be argued at next court date.  Arraignment scheduled for March 24, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Chadwick R. Clark in court in custody with attorney Jack C. Hoag.  Mary Elizabeth Bricco appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing requested, TIME LIMITS WAIVED.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 16, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Chadwick R. Clark in court in custody by video conference with attorney Valerie A. Zisman.  Jodi Dabson Bollendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint filed, copy to Defendant, penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. $30,000 cash bond set,   No contact directly or indirectly with victims, his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. No Firearms.
No contact directly or indirectly with victim, his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere., Not to possess any firearms.
